Pre-Game Insights: India are looking to try out personnel for the 2024 T20 World Cup
West Indies are rebuilding their T20I side
India don't have a left-hander in their first-choice top six in ODIs. If picked, Tilak Varma can fill that void
India have an eye on the upcoming ODI World Cup, and Tilak Varma has emerged as a strong candidate for the No. 4 slot in that squad
West Indies are not going to the ODI World Cup, but under Rovman Powell, they are rebuilding their T20I side
Team news: If fit, Jason Holder should replace Roston Chase. West Indies can also consider bringing in Shai Hope for one of Brandon King and Johnson Charles
Expect India to stick with the same XI that won them the third T20I
Pitch and conditions: In the last two T20Is played in Lauderhill, India - batting first both times - posted 191 for 5 and 188 for 7. They won both
A 47% chance of rain in the afternoon may be a temptation for chasing
